result.title: Extra Info
result.content:
Arrays

Arrays is a way to store a series of numbers. Imagine if we had a class of 50, and we wanted to store their grades. Its not practical to make 50 integers: int s1, s2, s3...

So instead we can make it like this: int s[50];

the first student is s[0], second student is s[1], last student is s[49].

Here is the code, also included is how to sort and reverse arrays: http://ideone.com/27E4wf

Look at powerpoint arrays and vectors from here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B54r2jukjz9wZ2JOcDJiWWdfZnc

Vectors are a way to allocate a series of grades if you dont know how many people there are beforehand. The powerpoint has more details.

Frequency Array

This is a very broad topic. Frequency array is used to keep track of the number of letters, or numbers, or literally anything you want to keep a count of. Here is a code of finding the frequency of each letter in a lowercase string: http://ideone.com/hvlGsX

Set

Imagine you had a question that wants you to take in make a dictionary of the words used in a text. And output them uniquely and they should also be sorted. You can do that using a set.

Sets have the following features:

  1. always ordered from smallest to largest (either alphabetically or numerically; depending on data type)

  2. contain only unique elements, no repetitions

  3. are accessed through an iterator, to get the element that the iterator is pointing at, you must do *(iterator_name)

For more information on its member functions and syntax, take a look at here: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/set/set/ Also take a look at slides 23 24 from day 1 from the above google drive for some example code.

Here is an example code of making dictionary of text: http://ideone.com/BLBaf3

Map

Take a look at slides 25 from day 1 from the above google drive for some example code.

The the map data structure is quite similar to the set data structure, other than the fact that maps help us to connect a key with a value. For example, the key could be name of grocery item, and the value could be its price. Here is some code that shows some features of it. http://ideone.com/tClL2K

They are ordered based on first element from smallest to largest also.

You can use it to count the frequency of strings like this: http://ideone.com/4yziZR
